titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Samuel Hacker Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:03

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection comprises printed material, including books, posters, postcards, and related ephemera, that pertain to the country of Germany, its people, history, and culture. The bulk of the material relates to the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei (Nazi Party). The majority of items cover the years 1927 to 1947.

langmaterial.language: The materials are in German, with some Yiddish and English.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Henry S. Hacker, 1991, 1992, and 2001.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Samuel Hacker Collection (MS 1612). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henry Samuel Hacker was born on December 26, 1942, in New York City. He graduated from Yale College in 1945 with a B.A., majoring in history. He has worked as an attorney and as executive vice-president of Alexander Julian, Inc. He is married to Andrea M. Prager with whom he has had three children. He is a collector of memorabilia from Nazi-Germany and the 1972 Olympic Games held in Munich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises printed materials, including books, posters, postcards, and related ephemera, that pertain to the country of Germany, its people, history, and culture. The bulk of the material relates to the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei (Nazi Party). The majority of items cover the years 1927 to 1947.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection must be used under the supervision of a Manuscripts and Archives Public Services staff member.

did.unittitle: Tages Programm, XI Olympische Spiele, Berlin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An official program from the 1936 Olympic Games (11th Olympiad) held in Berlin, Germany. The program contains lists of the International Olympic Committee members and officials and provides a list of the events held on August 3rd.

did.unittitle: Posters of the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei (Nazi Party)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of five posters commemorating the Olympic Games (20th Olympiad) in Munich.

langmaterial.language: Unless noted otherwise, materials are in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises two cigarette card albums and a collection of Nazi-era ephemera that includes a booklet of sketches, a calendar, cut-outs, postage stamps, postcards, posters, rally passes, a sticker, and telegrams. The bulk of the material consists of postcards and telegrams.

did.unittitle: Auf Deutscher Scholle , von Hans von der Nordmark

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Translated as "Out of German Soil," this cigarette card book is divided into chronological sections relating primarily to various aspects of German agriculture. Each section has descriptive text, interspersed with empty boxes for pasting in picture labels, corresponding to captions throughout. The picture labels were available by exchanging them for tokens from cigarette packs. Written in German script.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A cigarette card book depicting events in German history from the Middle Ages to 1914. Written in German script.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items are arranged to mirror the order in the "Guide to Nazi-Era Ephemera" in box 1, folder 3; namely, alphabetically by the category of the items. Within each category, items are listed numerically by identification numbers (supplied by the collector) which are sequential within a category only. Identification numbers appear in parentheses after the item.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The detailed guide, compiled by collector Samuel S. Hacker, depicts a color image of each item; an identification number; the type or category of the item; date; title; a description of the subject matter in German and English; and the dimensions of the item. Many descriptions of individual items in the guide have been used in the finding aid.

langmaterial.language: Printed text is Hebrew; language is Yiddish.

did.unittitle: Back From Hell, Collected Sketches , by Berl Friedler

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of bound sketches depicting images of Nazi aggression, the Holocaust, and atrocities at concentration camps. Printed with the assistance of the Central Committee of Liberated Jews in the British Zone of Germany and the American Joint Distribution Committee for the British Zone, 1947.

did.unittitle: Calendar (2080) with images of German political and military figures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A set of nine sheets of paper cut-outs, depicting military figures marching, saluting, and carrying Nazi banners; and members of the Jugend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Judenpost Litzmannstadt-Getto. A set of three stamps of different denominations with the Star of David, the profile of an unidentified figure, and imagery relating to industrial production, including factory smokestacks, a gearwheel, scissors, and a spool of thread.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcards, numbers 2003-2018, 2050, 2056-2057, and 2067, pertain to Nazi rallies. A rally, Reichsparteitag, was the meeting of the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei (NSDAP) or Nazi Party, from 1923-1938. With the exception of the first and second rallies, (Munich, 1923, and Weimar, 1926, respectively), they were held at the Nazi party rally grounds in Nuremberg, a city located in the center of the German Reich, from 1927-1938.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Nuremberg as the city of the party rallies. Watercolor view of the city, showing a parade through the streets, spectators, and buildings decorated with Nazi flags, wreaths, and banners.

did.unittitle: Nürnberg, die Stadt der Reichsparteitage. Adolf' Hitler Platz (2004)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard of Nuremberg's Adolf Hitler Square, showing large outdoor umbrellas in the square and some of the surrounding architecture. Lower half of the postcard is an advertisement for the Lumophon radios, made in Nuremberg, and shows the factory building.

did.unittitle: Zur Erinnerung an den Reichsparteitag 1934. Der NSDAP zu Nürnberg (2005)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Souvenir postcard of the 1934 Nuremberg rally with image of Nuremberg castle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a site map of the Nuremberg rally campus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stamps depict a similar composition to the postcard; eagle with swastika wreath hovering above Nuremberg castle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts symbols of heraldry.

did.unittitle: Zur Erinnerung an den Reichsparteitag der NSDAP (2009)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nuremberg Castle.

did.unittitle: Postcard with photograph of Hitler in Nuremberg in 1923 (2010)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On verso: Nürnberg 1923. Herausgegeben von der N. S. Volkswohlfahrt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitation to attend a meeting of the NS (Nationalsozialistischer) Reich's fighter federation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts uniformed soldier bearing shovel and backpack at rally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts young girl in uniform. Postage stamp is from Czechoslovakia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Commemorates ten years of rallies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts soldier marching in formation; Nuremberg Castle in background.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard from the first great German rally depicting a red map of Germany, superimposed over a stylized eagle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the rally stadium with Nazi flags.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a young girl in uniform.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts German in uniform with Nazi flag. Cancellation stamp reads Parteitag Grossdeutschlands.

did.unittitle: Ein Volk Ein Reich Ein Führer Reichsparteitag Nürnberg (2057)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a collage of coats of arms surrounding image of a golden swastika.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Nazi postage stamps bearing Hitler's likeness.

did.unittitle: Baufahrt der Alten Kämpfer der Bayerischen Ostmark (2019)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes a tour to sites pertaining to fighters of Bavarian East Germany, highlighting the Dietrich Eckart Memorial and the Walhalla, a building resembling the Parthenon in Athens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcards, numbers 2020-2023, and 2025, pertain to the Nationalsozialistisches Fliegerkorps (National Socialist Flyers Corps) established by Hitler, April 17, 1937, to take over military pilot training from the Deutscher Luftsport-Verband (German Air Sports Association).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On verso: Das NS-Fliegerkorps ruft die Jugend zum Dienst in der Luftfahrt- (Calling the youth to service in aviation).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts close-up of a pilot in cockpit in flight.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a yellow propeller plane in midair with "D-E HAK" on its wings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a young pilot in a biplane.

did.unittitle: On verso: Die jüngste Nachwuchs der Luftwaffe wird durch das NS-Fliegerkorps im Modellflug ausgebildet (2025)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a young boy in uniform setting off a model airplane in flight.

did.unittitle: On verso: Deutsche Luftsport=Verband. Werde Mitglied! (2024)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard for the German Air Sports Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard for the Enzian Division commemorating its four year anniversary. Grouped with a pamphlet, Ein Ruhmesblatt in der Geschichte der Division , by Uffz. J. M. Rubner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Covers depict SA (storm troopers) uniformed soldiers in various work activities; no text.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcards 2034-2035 pertain to a para-military body created by NSDAP, making up the armed wing of the Schutzstaffel ("Protective Squadron") or SS, an organ of the Nazi Party.

did.unittitle: Melde Dich freiwillig zu den Gebirgstruppen der Waffen-SS (2034)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard for the mountain troops of the SS.

did.unittitle: Deutsche Jugend meldet sich freiwillig zur Waffen-SS (2035)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard for the Hitler youth to join the SS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official remembrance postcard from 1938 November 9 depicting three Germans in different uniforms, bearing the Nazi flag.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard reproduction of an original drawing by Heinz Wever-Berlin depicting the Stahlhelm marching. Stahlhelm is German for steel helmet, and refered often to frontline soldiers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a mother and her children harvesting wheat in foreground, with a flaksoldaten (aircraft spotter) in background.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a large housing development in a coal field. NSG refers to Neue Shütz-Gesellschaft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reproduction of oil painting depicting a visionary interpretation of the Third Reich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts three workers looking at a monument with Hitler's image and the saying, Arbeit adelt (work is ennobling).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts stylized hand with two fingers raised, as in salute to an eagle, and a swastika wreath.

did.unittitle: Reichsnährstand. Blut und Boden. Reichsbauerntag Goslar 1938 (2054)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blood and soil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts railroad worker signalling the trains in front of the face of a large stop watch.

did.unittitle: On verso: Innenansicht der Ehrenhalle der Nationalsozialisten Buchholz, Kreis Harburg/W. (2058)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts interior view of the Nazi Hall of Honor.

did.unittitle: W Hitler. W Mussolini. Anno XVI. Pace Civiltà Lavoro (2059)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts medallion portraits of Hitler and Mussolini; Nazi and Fascist (?) flag.

did.unittitle: 1238/1938. Lößnitz im Erzegebirge. 700 Jahrfeier u. Heimatfest 23.-31. Juli 1938 (2060)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Celebrates the 700 year anniversary of town of Lößnitz (also spelled Lössnitz).

did.unittitle: On verso: Tag der Deutschen Polizei 1941 (2061)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Celebrates the day of the German police.

did.unittitle: Tag der Deutschen Kunst München 1937 16. - 18. Juli (2062)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Celebrates the day of German art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Celebrates the 700 year anniversary of the city of Gera.

did.unittitle: Grosser Preis von Europa für Motorräder auf dem Sachsenring bei Hohenstein-Ernstthal am 7. August 1938 (2064)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a motorcycle race and spectators, with Nazi, Italian (Fascist?), and English flags.

did.unittitle: Alpenland Deutsch u. Frei. Untergruppe Alpenland West (2065)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Nazi flag with swastika wreath above alpine landscape.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Celebrates the German harvest.

did.unittitle: 28 Novembre 1937. 28 Nendor 1937. 25 Vjet Shqipni. 25 Années d'Albanie (2068)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Twenty-five years of Albania.

did.unittitle: Die NSDAP Sichert die Volks-Gemeinschaft. Volksgenossen braucht ihr Rat und Hilfe so wendet euch an die Ortsgruppe

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei (NSDAP) celebrates the German family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Admission tickets to the 1937 and 1938 Nuremberg rallies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The North Sea beach is free from Jews. Depicts female bather.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The telegrams, also called telegram cards, resemble oversize greeting cards, with an image or design on the cover, space for a greeting inside, and a back cover. Deutsche Reichspost may appear on the front or back covers. Telegrams from the 1930s usually have the image of an eagle on a swastika wreath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts an engraving of a winding river and trees.

did.unittitle: Nürnberg die Stadt der Reichsparteitage. Deutsche Reichspost (2070)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts city of Nuremberg with swastika at bottom center, flanked by two coats of arms.

did.unittitle: Watercolor of Hitler standing in a motor vehicle, giving Nazi salute; rendering of Nuremberg Castle in distance (2071)
On back cover: Garnisonkirche zu Potsdam (2072)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cover depicts an eagle soaring above a row of Nazi flags. Back cover shows view of Potsdam's Garnisonkirche (church).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cover shows silhouette image of a trumpeting figure on horseback, packet in hand, possibly a telegram courier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts woodcut of an engagement/wedding procession. Message inside.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts two stylized doves carrying ribbons. Message inside.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a rococo-style wreath of flowers, cupids, and doves. Message inside.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts babies and children playing with toys. Message inside.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a mountain landscape. Includes envelope with eagle on a swastika wreath, printed in red.

did.unittitle: Print sheet of six color images promoting the Reichsparteitag Nürnberg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some images used for postcards pictured in the guide to Nazi-era ephemera. Verso depicts unidentified landscape painting.
